Class Board

public class Board extends Coordinate implements Enums
Technically the driver that handles the game itself.

  • Constructor Details

    • Board

      public Board()
      Constructs a null version of the visual and literal Playing Boards, as well as a null version of the Eliminated Pieces side displays.

    • Board

      public Board​(List<Piece> pieces)
      Uses the 0-arg constructor and addAll(List)
      Parameters:
      pieces - - A full set of pieces.

    • Board

      public Board​(List<Piece> pieces, javafx.scene.layout.GridPane grid, javafx.scene.control.TextField Messenger, javafx.scene.layout.GridPane blackElim, javafx.scene.layout.GridPane whiteElim, javafx.scene.text.Text GUIB, javafx.scene.text.Text GUIW, long TimeWanted, javafx.scene.text.Text WhiteElims, javafx.scene.text.Text BlackElims)
      Populates the previously created gui components and starts the speed chess timers if requested.
      Parameters:
      pieces - - A full set of pieces
      grid - - The GUI chess board
      Messenger - - The TextField used to display the current turn and errors.
      blackElim - - The GUI list of eliminated black pieces.
      whiteElim - - The GUI list of eliminated white pieces.
      GUIB - - The Text used to display the remaining time for the black player or "Chess"
      GUIW - - The Text used to display the remaining time for the white player or "Centaur".
      TimeWanted - - The time requested (speed chess) by the player.
      WhiteElims - - Text javafx property displaying points of eliminated white pieces
      BlackElims - - Text javafx property displaying points of eliminated black pieces

  • Method Details

    • addAll

      public void addAll​(List<Piece> pieces)
      Adds all the freshly created pieces to the literal playing board
      Parameters:
      pieces - - the pieces created by the Piece createPieces static method

    • MovePiece

      public boolean MovePiece​(Piece piece, Coordinate NewCoor)
      There are 5 outcomes when a piece is trying to be moved. 1) The tile selected is not an available option. 2) The tile selected is vacant and no swapping needs to take place 3) The move intended is a castle move 4) The move intended is an en passant move 5) No special move is requested but the tile isn't vacant, requiring a swap.
      Parameters:
      piece - - The piece that will be moved
      NewCoor - - The coordinate the piece will be moved to.
      Returns:
      True if the coordinate is an available coordinate. False if the coordinate isn't.

    • slot

      public static Piece slot​(Coordinate coor)
      Can be used to peek into the literal board.
      Parameters:
      coor - - The coordinate that the piece will be extracted from
      Returns:
      The piece on located at coor on the literal board. Returns null if the coordinate is out of bounds or if the piece doesn't exist.

    • UpdateGUI

      public void UpdateGUI()
      Update the visual board.

    • resetColor

      public void resetColor()
      Resets the tiles' colors to their original colors.

      Parameters:
      coor - - The coordinate of the pane / rectangle.
      Returns:
